alert.note: Alert for Park; Sweet Grass (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 10:19AM MDT until June 15 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Unprecedented flooding occurring on the following rivers in Montana... Yellowstone River near Livingston affecting Sweet Grass and Park Counties. .Heavy rain falling on the snowpack over the southern Beartooth/Absaroka mountains has resulted in unprecedented rises on the Yellowstone River at Corwin Springs and Livingston. The river is currently higher than has ever been recorded at Corwin Springs and continues to rise. This flood water will push into Livingston later today where the record stage of 10.7 recorded in 1997 has already been exceeded. How far above flood stage the Yellowstone River will rise is hard to determine due to uncertainties with the rain falling on the snow in the high country. As a result the forecast crest should be used as a starting point and not a definite peak. The river will continue to rise until rainfall subsides and high elevation temperatures drop to around freezing, slowing snowmelt. If you live or are recreating near the river move to higher ground, and expect higher water levels than have previously been experienced. Additional updates to the river forecast and warning will be made as more information becomes available. For the Yellowstone River...including Corwin Springs and Livingston...Unprecedented flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Unprecedented flooding is occuring. * WHERE...Yellowstone River near Livingston. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Some minor overflow occurs along the lowest areas throughout the reach of the river and across the road connecting the island with the rest of town. At 10.0 feet, Roads to Mill Creek, Cinnabar Basin and Trail Creek are covered with water. Water will also be over portions of Yellowstone Park road for 800 yards, 3.5 miles south of town, including a few farm homes. Flooding over the road to 9th Street island with water reaching some homes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM MDT Monday the stage was 10.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM MDT Monday was 10.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 11.8 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning to 7.8 feet early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.7 feet on 06/06/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Yellowstone River Livingston 10.0 10.8 Mon 8 am 9.9 8.7 7.9 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings. Safety message...A river Flood Warning means river flooding is expected to impact people and property in the warned area. Prepare for flooding impacts associated with the forecast river levels in your location. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 1030 PM MDT.
